meanings.definition: Subinfeudates: to grant land to a tenant who in turn becomes a landlord to subtenants.
meanings.sent1: The landowner subinfeudates his property to a tenant who then rents it out to others.
meanings.sent2: She subinfeudates the farm to a tenant who will manage it and sublet to others.
meanings.sent3: The landlord subinfeudates the land to a tenant who decides to host a farm animal party.
meanings.sent4: He subinfeudates his authority like a king passing his crown to a loyal subject.
meanings.sent5: Subinfeudating the land creates a chain of landlords and tenants, like a never-ending story.

meanings.definition: Subinfeudates: a person who holds land as a tenant from a superior landlord and in turn grants it to subtenants.
meanings.sent1: The subinfeudates manage the land on behalf of the main landlord.
meanings.sent2: She is a subinfeudates who oversees the property and its subtenants.
meanings.sent3: The subinfeudates throw a surprise party for the subtenants on the land.
meanings.sent4: He is the subinfeudates, passing on the responsibility to the subtenants like a relay race.
meanings.sent5: The subinfeudates are like the middlemen in a land-sharing game, ensuring everyone plays fair.
